title: Crypto Zone
author: Crypto Zone
content: I went to the profile of some users and clicked on the trust system and found that they got green trust and some of them have red trust.And go to my account and see there is a post a new feedback and trust settings options. I really don't understand these things can someone give me some details please?

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: You can ready this: LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust systemForm the guide, you will be able to know what trust feedback and trust list are which is the exactly the question that you are asking.In addition, if you want to be a DT2 member, someone in DT1 must add your to his trust list. If you want to become a DT1 member, theymos must add you to it.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Kindly check this thread and I hope you will easily understand the trust system of BitcointalkA short introduction to the Trust SystemIn short when any DT member left feedback on any profile, will changes the trust score to green in case of positive or red in case of negative. Remember that only DT member feedback will changes the trust rate to green or red while other users feedback will not make any changes to the user trust.

comments.author: Crypto Library
comments.body: Buddy don't be so confused. Just read this topic  LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system here details  are given with screenshots.  oh wow, the Telegram notification bot is working very well . As I post I see many buddies have already posted. Or am I a  turtle

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Zone on October 02, 2023, 07:49:06 AMI went to the profile of some users and clicked on the trust system and found that they got green trust and some of them have red trust.I needed many months to realize trust, trust feedback, what they are. It is interesting to see a pure newbies immediately fall in Trust, Trust feedback.QuoteAnd go to my account and see there is a post a new feedback and trust settings options. I really don't understand these things can someone give me some details please? Guides are above but as a newbie, you don't need to learn about it first.Learn about Bitcoin as it is more important for why you are in Bitcointalk forum.Next you can learn forum rules as you can be banned by breaking rules.With Trust, trust feedback, if you don't trade with other members, you don't need it. You will not be banned by Trust or Trust Feedback. It is less important than forum rules.List of forum rules.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Zone on October 02, 2023, 07:49:06 AMI went to the profile of some users and clicked on the trust system and found that they got green trust and some of them have red trust.And go to my account and see there is a post a new feedback and trust settings options. I really don't understand these things can someone give me some details please? Others have sent links wherr you will learn about the trust system feedback, but I want to explain little to you based on your question in OP so that you will have a tip of what you will expect in the links.Green feedback means the trust is positive and it goes to the left side of the + 0 -. You give someone positive trust if they have transacted with you without issues and if you feel they are not likely to scam. The Red feedback is negative which goes to the right side. You leave negative feedback is someone has scammed or cheated. The last is the neutral tag. You use it when the feedback is neither positive enough nor negative enough.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: You don't need to think much about the trust system if you don't want to conduct business or send money to any of the accounts, but if you do, do it with members in good standing who have a good number of green trusts from multiple users, or ask the other person to use Bitcointalk escrow service.I remember that it took me several days to learn how the trust system works, so you will learn with time, and read this post if you want to contribute to making it better -----> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5191802.0

comments.author: Huppercase
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Zone on October 02, 2023, 07:49:06 AMI went to the profile of some users and clicked on the trust system and found that they got green trust and some of them have red trust.And go to my account and see there is a post a new feedback and trust settings options. I really don't understand these things can someone give me some details please? The feedback is a way of telling how a user should be trusted, for the people you saw green, it means that they are trustworthy people and you can trade anything with them, you have nothing to fear but you should still put caution when trading because it doesn't justify what happened in the future.Similarly, a red trust person who have negative in their profile, the feedback should tell you what they did and a link as reference will be there on their profile why you should not trust them or even trade with them but again, you need to check the reference link to see if the accusations is justified or maybe not, there are instances where red trust and feed back are later change to neutral tag.Quote from: _act_ on October 02, 2023, 07:51:50 AMIn addition, if you want to be a DT2 member, someone in DT1 must add your to his trust list. If you want to become a DT1 member, theymos must add you to it.Not necessary DT1 must include you to become DT2, numbers of DT2 can include you to become a DT2 also.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: Huppercase on October 02, 2023, 10:19:09 AMNot necessary DT1 must include you to become DT2, numbers of DT2 can include you to become a DT2 also.This is wrong. You can't be a DT member if you are not in trust list of any DT1 member. For being a DT2 member, you need to be in trust list of at least 1 DT1 member and the number of DT1 members who have included you in their trust list must be bigger or equal to number of users who have excluded you from their trust list.

comments.author: Huppercase
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on October 02, 2023, 10:44:09 AMQuote from: Huppercase on October 02, 2023, 10:19:09 AMNot necessary DT1 must include you to become DT2, numbers of DT2 can include you to become a DT2 also.This is wrong. You can't be a DT member if you are not in trust list of any DT1 member. For being a DT2 member, you need to be in trust list of at least 1 DT1 member and the number of DT1 members who have included you in their trust list must be bigger or equal to number of users who have excluded you from their trust list. Oooh. I never knew that. I always thought any DT2 that is included in DT1 can add you to their trust list and multiples of this can turn the person to automatically another DT2.Thank you.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Zone on October 02, 2023, 07:49:06 AMI really don't understand these things can someone give me some details please? I noticed you joined the forum back in July, but it seems you haven't been too active in terms of posting. My suggestion would be to get involved in discussions and get to know some fellow forum members better before diving too deeply into the Trust system. It's a good way to ease into things!

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Zone on October 02, 2023, 07:49:06 AMI went to the profile of some users and clicked on the trust system and found that they got green trust and some of them have red trust.And go to my account and see there is a post a new feedback and trust settings options. I really don't understand these things can someone give me some details please? If you're indeed a newbie to this forum, i will suggest that you have less concern about the DT for know till you're able to get familiar with how the forum works and you've gained a good stay with the level of your knowledge on how things work as well on the forum, i don't expect a newbie to put more concentrations on that when they needed to know other important things ahead, when the time comes, everything will work perfectly as expected, you will understand who to add and not after you would have been used to some reputable members of the forum you think deserve being on your trust list.

comments.author: Shishir99
comments.body: Quote from: Crypto Library on October 02, 2023, 07:53:10 AMAs I post I see many buddies have already posted. Or am I a  turtle You were a minute and a half late from the first post. You are not a turtle but you take a little longer to write the post. Maybe you were searching for the topic link you mentioned. Right? I know I am right. LOL   These thing happens to all of us. We write the post and now we have to provide a source which needed to be searched first, and then we realize a couple of members already posted. I have seen some topic in wallet software board and I wanted to write, after finishing the writing, I realized a couple of members already posted before me and the meaning of my post and their is almost similar. Most of the time I do not post them anymore.
